title: Female paedophile spared jail despite having 2,000 child abuse images
text:
Jasmine Rowbottom, 24, was spared jail after being found guilty (Picture: SWNS)

A woman claimed she had hundreds of child abuse images on her computer because of a virus.

Jasmine Rowbottom, 24, was spared jail despite having almost 2,000 pictures on her hard drive.

Many of them involved extreme pornography and images of children being sexually abused.

She was arrested in June 2016 and the investigation involved more than 50 pieces of computer equipment.

She denied the offences and claimed the images must have been caused by the virus on her PC or a USB stick given to her years earlier.

Rowbottom was found guilty at Wolverhampton Crown Court yesterday of making indecent images and video of children and possession of extreme pornography.

She was given a 21-month prison term suspended for two years.

She was also given a two-year supervision order, was placed on the sexual harm prevention order for 10 years and the sex offenders register for 10 years.
